ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: background information about the practice and theory of agroforestry in New England

An overview of where agroforestry currently, ought to, and did fit into the U.S. and global agricultural economy. An overview of the environmental and economic benefits and costs of introducing trees to agricultural systems, and the forces that slow and prevent the introduction. Practical knowledge of how agroforestry systems function nutritionally/environmental and economically, and practical skills of how to set up agroforestry systems.
Good understanding of agroforestry practices and how they're being implemented.

As the title states, I learned about the scientific and practical aspects of agroforestry systems. I gained insight into the role agroforestry may play in ecosystem restoration, landscape design, and food systems.

The scientific consensus and current technical opinions about agroforestry, but also an overview of agriculture and forestry. Incentives and barriers for agroforestry. How to evaluate sites and trees and how to plan agroforestry projects.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: There was more practical engagement with the material but less historical / political material than expected.
Great, definitely covered a lot of new ground and information I didn't previously know about
This course was full of interesting information and field trips--both of which I found conducive to learning.
Quite well! Please note that I was auditing the class and my evaluation will reflect this level of engagement as an auditor.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was extremely engaging, and was a delight to attend each class. I went from a place of near total agroforestry ignorance to now having a breadth of big picture and practical knowledge in the field. I was not in the majority as a student who wanted to learn about scalability, but I would have loved to learn more about large agroforestry operations in the U.S.
I would have liked to have more time in class for group discussions of the readings and/or lecture material.
Strengths were in good field trips, great lecture material and classes. Weaknesses in lack of expectations of final project, incorporation of some of the readings into lecture material.

The field trips were great and much appreciated. It would be great if there was a short section at the end of each module to discuss how the lessons learned would be applied to agroforestry system design. Personally, I would have appreciated a nudge or two--i.e. outline or literature review--to submit for the term project earlier in the semester.

Strengths: good combination of scientific lectures and discussions about practical implementation. Many examples and case studies. I really enjoyed the field trips. Weaknesses: While the many examples were very interesting and helpful, it would have been nice to talk about overall themes that could be applied to different regions. More examples from other regions would have been nice (if there is existing literature), for example from Africa, Asia, South America.

I felt that the concepts really were solidified when I was able to see them in the field (ex. on the oak springs field trip )- the more fieldwork the better though I appreciate that field trips are expensive!

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
